  • Element
com.github.nitnelave.xmlparser

Annotation Type XMLNode


  • @Documented
@Retention(value=RUNTIME)
@Target(value=TYPE)
public @interface XMLNode

    Annotation to describe an XML node structure. For the properties, see XMLProperties.

    There are 2 special types of nodes:
    • Root nodes, defined by type = XMLNodeType.ROOT. Root nodes cannot have parents, and will raise an exception if read as an inner node.
    • Default node, defined by type = XMLNodeType.DEFAULT. It must be unique. If an unknown XML tag is recognized, a default node is created. Its name attribute will be ignored, but if the class provides a setName(String name) method, it will be called with the name of the tag. The default node can have properties, but they cannot be required.
    By default, a node can have any other node as parent. If the parentNode is defined, then it can only be parsed as a direct child of its parentNode, or it will raise an exception.

    Upon reading the opening tag, the handleBegin(MyNode n) will be called for every applicable registered listener. At this point, the node only has information about its properties.

    Upon reading the closing tag, the handle(MyNode n) will be called for every applicable registered listener. At this point, the node has all information available: properties, content, and sub-nodes.

    If a node is missing a property marked required, any corresponding XML tag missing the property will raise an exception upon parsing.

    Constructors

    • The XML nodes will be created with the empty constructor. Make sure to provide a meaningful one.
    • The classes for the node content and the properties must have a constructor taking a String as unique parameter. For a simple number, use Integer.class.
    Author:
    nitnelave
    See Also:
    XMLParser, XMLProperty, XMLProperties, XMLStructureException

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      Class<?> contentType
      The class of the (optional) content.
      String name
      The name of the XML tag to recognize, and the name of the parent method to set the child.
      Class<?>[] parentNodes
      The class of the parent node in the XML structure.
      boolean resetContent
      Whether to reset the content when seeing a child.
      boolean single
      The arity of the node.
      XMLNodeType type
      The type of the node.
      boolean updateContent
      Whether to update the content when seeing a child.

    • Element Detail

      • name

        public abstract String name
        The name of the XML tag to recognize, and the name of the parent method to set the child. As xml is case insensitive, it is recommended to type this field in CamelCase to have a nice method name.
        E.g. if the field is Node, then the method addNode(Node n) of the parent node will be called if found.

        If the field is left empty, then the name will default to the class short name. NB: The prefix of the method can be changed with the single field.

        Returns:
        The name of the XML tag
        Default:
        ""

      • type

        public abstract XMLNodeType type
        The type of the node. Either NORMAL (by default), ROOT or DEFAULT.
        Returns:
        The type of the node.
        Default:
        com.github.nitnelave.xmlparser.XMLNodeType.NORMAL

      • parentNodes

        public abstract Class<?>[] parentNodes
        The class of the parent node in the XML structure.
        If the class is None (by default), then the node can have any node as parent.
        Returns:
        The parent node's class
        Default:
        {}

      • single

        public abstract boolean single
        The arity of the node.
        Determines the name of the method called when adding the node to its parent node.
        If it is false (default), the name of the method is "add" + name;
        if true, it is "set" + name;
        Returns:
        True if it is a single node.
        Default:
        false

      • contentType

        public abstract Class<?> contentType
        The class of the (optional) content.
        This defines what object will be constructed from the content inside the XML tag. If the contentType is not None, then the class must define a method setContent(String s).
        Returns:
        The content class.
        Default:
        com.github.nitnelave.xmlparser.None.class

      • updateContent

        public abstract boolean updateContent
        Whether to update the content when seeing a child. Whenever a child of the node is seen, update the content. This allows to see the position of inner child nodes inside the content.
        Returns:
        Whether to update the content when seeing a child.
        Default:
        true

      • resetContent

        public abstract boolean resetContent
        Whether to reset the content when seeing a child. Whenever a child of the node is seen, reset the buffer (only applicable if updateContent = true). If that's the case, then the same text will not be reported twice when updating the content.

        For example, for this file: 

             <Container>
         The car is <color>red</color>. I like that car.
     </Container>
        The content of Container is split by a child node. So calls to container will be:
        • resetContent = true:
          • container.setContent("The car is ");
          • container.setColor(Color red);
          • container.setContent(". I like that car");
        • resetContent = false:
          • container.setContent("The car is ");
          • container.setColor(Color red);
          • container.setContent("The car is . I like that car");
        Returns:
        Whether to update the content when seeing a child.
        Default:
        false
